page.title: 13INDUSTRY-1
page.content:
Until 1978 the major source of employment in the Cummock Valley was coal mining. At its peak there were several collieries with rail links to Dunaskin Waterside in the Doon Valley nearby. Latterly the workforce travelled in to the last pit- Pennyvenie- as most had moved to better, more modern housing from the old colliery rows.
Coal extraction is still an employer in the valley. In 1978 opencast quarrying began up valley below Benbain on the sites of the former Beoch collieries. While production is high few men are required. The operation taps coal seams traditional mining found either uneconomic or too dangerous to work. The coal is taken by lorry to the Dunaskin railhead.
